creator: nicolaken@apache.org
text:
This task takes the nodes in an XML file and makes properties out of it.

    <root-tag>
      <inner-tag>Text</inner-tag>
      <2><3><4>false</4></3></2>  
      <other name="mine"> 
    </root-tag>
     
   myattr=true
   inner-tag=Text
   2.3.4=false
   other.name=mine

It can keep the root tag or not and add a prefix or not.

If you think to accept the donation, please tell me where it's going to go, and 
I will submit a patch+docs.
It could be indipendent (core or optional?) or become part of the property 
task).

-- 
Nicola Ken Barozzi                   nicolaken@apache.org

text:
I'm now looking at the code.  Here are my suggestions:

- Resubmit with Apache license header and as 
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.XmlPropertyTask

- Submit HTML documentation and defaults.properties patch

- Change setFile to accept java.io.File param (otherwise you'll have relative 
path issues)

Is there anything here that won't work in JDK 1.1?

Sorry for the delay, Im really swamped :-(

Here is the latest version I did, that checks if a property is already there 
and adds [number] to it.
It also creates a list of properties that I use with the contrib for-each task.

Just a note: I set userProperties, because I use task for this reason. See if 
you prefer to switch to setNewProperty.

Feel free to commit this or the previous version as you deem more fit, if time 
is important.
Otherwise, please let me know what you think of the above points, and I will do 
my best to have this done over the weekend.

Thank you :-)

latest dev version of XmlPropertyTask.java

Nicola - I've modified and committed a version of this task.  Its working 
nicely, but needs more tests and of course documentation.

Changes I made:

  - attributes get set using "root-tag(attrname)" format.
  - the root node was not being processed for attributes, so i made a change to 
pick that up
  - Changed XML file attribute setter to java.io.File.
  - Changed ".list" property to be "[]" instead - to avoid conflicts with an 
element named "list".
  - Changed setUserProperty to setNewProperty - keep in mind that immutability 
will prevent properties from being set if they are already set - which is the 
desired behavior.

I think there are still some issues with indexes and such that we can fix now 
that its committed to Ant.

Let me know if these changes are cool with you and what is needed to get this 
polished off.  This is a very powerful addition to Ant, I think!

Gee, I love it when someone else touches my code. It seems that it magically 
gets better faster :-)

I've polished it, and added the documentation.

Changes I made:

  - attributes can also get set using "root-tag.attrname" format if 
collapseAttributes=true.
  - removed "[]" entirely since it was plainly broken and I don't use it anyway
  - removed all the tag[n] entirely for the same reason. 

I think it should work ok now, and my preliminar tests are ok. I'm using it 
instead of my old task in my builds and the quick runs I did seem to have no 
problems.

Thanks a bunch for committing it :-)
